Dua—Thra Dante was in relations with the Malaspini in Lunigiana in the autumn of 1306 is known from extant documents dated October 6 of that year.⁶ From these it appears that he then, as the guest of Franceschino Malaspina at Sarzana,⁷ acted as procurator for the Malaspina family in their negotiations for peace with their neighbour, the Bishop of Luni, which by his means was successfully concluded. The duration of his stay with the Malaspini is uncertain, but it probably did not last beyond the summer of 1307. The present
